meanings.definition: To be surpassed in skill or ability by someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The young team was outmatched by the experienced champions.
meanings.sent2: The underdog team was outmatched by the stronger opponents.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outmatched by the clever raccoon in the nut-gathering contest.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outmatched her fear, allowing her to conquer the challenge.
meanings.sent5: The tiny ant outmatched the big beetle in carrying the heavy leaf.

meanings.definition: To be overwhelmed or overpowered by an opponent or adversary.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were outmatched by the enemy's advanced weaponry.
meanings.sent2: The superhero was outmatched by the supervillain's evil powers.
meanings.sent3: The cat was outmatched by the cunning mouse in the game of cat and mouse.
meanings.sent4: His courage outmatched his doubts, leading him to face his fears head-on.
meanings.sent5: The small boat was outmatched by the powerful waves during the storm.
